III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4407 Facility and premises maintenance.
Section (1) A facility and premises shall be maintained in a clean,
Description comfortable, and safe condition. The facility shall be located on
land that is properly drained.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
1

Allegation There are concerns for cleanliness of the building. There is mold
in the refrigerator. The lights were not working. There are
cameras in the shower area.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
09/21/2023.
The complainant was anonymous.
I made an unannounced visit on 09/22/2023. I interviewed Chief
Administrator (CA), who reported there have been no concerns
reported regarding the cleanliness of the cottages, mold, or lights
not working. She said they are in the process of installing cameras
in the cottages, but there are no cameras in the bathrooms or
bedrooms.
I walked through the cottages on 09/22/2023 and observed
bedrooms, bathrooms, living room, dining room, and kitchen area.
One bathroom shower door needed cleaning, but the facility is in
the process of replacing the shower doors with shower curtains.
This is not neglect but observed to need cleaning. The rest of the
rooms were found to be clean, neat, no mold in the refrigerator, and
all light fixtures working. No Safety or neglect issues found and no
cameras were observed in the bathrooms.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 09/22/2023. Youth A has
been at the facility for 6 months. Youth A reported all his needs are
being met. He is participating in therapy, gets enough to eat, and
feels safe. He said they are required to clean their bedrooms and
staff will assist if they need help. Each youth has specific chores
and staff help with cleaning the cottages. He denied seeing
cameras in the bathrooms.
I interviewed Youth B and C at the facility on 09/22/2023. Both
youths reported feeling safe and having all their needs met. They
expressed no concerns regarding the cottages not being clean.
They reported there are no cameras in the bathrooms.
Analysis The agency is compliant with the rule as there is no evidence the
cottages are not clean, lights are not working, or there is mold in
the refrigerator. The facility is process of installing cameras in the
living room and area outside of the bedrooms, but there are no
cameras in the bathrooms or bedrooms.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
2

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement and
to provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision
of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A few days prior, a youth overdosed and survived.
Investigation Chief Administrator reported that Youth A had AWOLed on the
morning of 09/17/2023 and was later found by a neighbor outside
of campus passed out. Police and EMS was contacted, and Youth
A was transported to the hospital. Youth A has a substance abuse
problem and AWOLs from campus daily. A 30 day replacement
notice was submitted for Youth A on 07/17/2023 due to excessive
AWOLing and substance abuse.
I attempted to interview Youth A at the facility on 09/22/2023 in
reference to the incident, but he refused to answer questions
regarding the AWOL or the substance abuse.
Documents Reviewed:
• Facility’s AWOL policy. Staff are expected to make all efforts
to maintain eyesight of the youth(s). If youths leave the
grounds, staff should get a van and follow them. If youths
AWOL but stay on campus and go into the woods, staff
should contact the supervisor, follow calmly on foot, and
verbally attempt to return them. Staff must follow youths as far
as possible without endangering their own safety. If youths
retreat further into the woods and staff lose eyesight of them,
the police should be contacted, and a missing persons reports
filed.
• Incident report dated 09/17/2023 at 10:30 am, written by Staff
1. Youth A left the cottage without permission. Staff 1 followed
Youth to Six Mile, talking and encouraging youth to return to
campus, Youth A refused to return to campus. On-call
supervisor contacted, and police report filed.
• Incident report dated 09/17/2023 at 1:40 pm, written by Staff
2. Youth A was found vomiting outside of the campus by a
neighbor. EMS was contacted and Youth A was transported to
the hospital. Youth A admitted to ingesting weed and ecstasy.
Youth A was treated and discharged.
• Medical report for Youth A, dated 09/17/2023. Youth A treated
for vomiting. Diagnosis substance abuse (marijuana). Youth A
3

was treated with Zofran and sodium chloride and discharged
back to campus.
• Youth A’s 30-day removal letter dated 07/17/2023. As of
07/17/2023 Youth A had AWOLed 35 times. Youth A
requires constant redirection and 1:1 supervision, when on
campus. Even with this 1:1 supervision, Youth A continues
to AWOL off of campus. Youth A has engaged in several
acts of physical aggression, that have led to him being
placed in a juvenile detention facility. Youth A was also
arrested for breaking into another facility. Youth A poses a
dangerous risk to the safety of this campus. While Youth A
is routinely searched, Youth A has attempted to bring back
razors, lighters, marijuana, and other items that are
dangerous for Youth A as well as the other youth within
facility. Youth A has threatened to bring a gun to campus
and harm both staff and other youths.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule, Staff were supervising Youth
A prior to him going AWOL and followed the facility’s AWOL
policy. Youth was found vomiting outside of the campus by a
neighbor and transported to the hospital for substance abuse.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
